title: Get to know your opponent: Alabama
text:
Get to know your opponent: Alabama The Vols football team looks to get its first SEC road victory this season. Post to Facebook Get to know your opponent: Alabama The Vols football team looks to get its first SEC road victory this season.  //on.wbir.com/1LRpubR   Join the Conversation To   Get to know your opponent: Alabama In our weekly, "Vols Film Study" segment, Patrick Murray breaks down the ways Tennessee's offense might be able to have success in against Alabama's intimidating defense. WBIR Mark Bergin, WBIR 9:27 a.m. EDT October 23, 2015 Alabama coach Nick Saban 5 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
(WBIR - KNOXVILLE) The Tennessee Volunteers football team is looking to get its first road SEC win this season against the Alabama Crimson Tide on Saturday. Here's what you need to know about the Vols' opponent. 
Overview: The Vols (3-3, 1-2 SEC) are coming off of a bye week after defeating the Georgia Bulldogs for their first SEC win this season. 
Tennessee is seeking its first win over a Top 10 opponent since 2006. That year the Vols defeated No. 10 Georgia 51-33 in Athens. Since that victory, Tennessee has lost 24 consecutive games against Top 10 opponents. 
No. 8 Alabama beat Texas A&M 41-23 in College Station last weekend. The Crimson Tide returned three interceptions for touchdowns. 
Game Time: 3:30 p.m. Eastern Time 
TV: CBS 
2014 Record: (12-2, 7-1 SEC) 
2015 Record: 6-1 (3-1 SEC) 
Coach: Nick Saban 
Series against UT: The Crimson Tide lead the all-time series 52-38-7. Alabama has won the last eight meetings between the two teams. 
Alabama won last season's contest 34-20 at Neyland Stadium. 
Tennessee last defeated Alabama 16-13 on Oct. 21, 2006, at home. 
The Vols' last win against the Crimson Tide in Tuscaloosa was a 51-43 quintuple-overtime thriller on Oct. 25, 2003. 
Tennessee is 4-7 all-time in games played in Tuscaloosa. Vols vs. Tide: Butch says "we're going down there to win" 
Things to Know 
1. Alabama head coach Nick Saban has never lost to Tennessee since he took over as coach at Alabama in January 2007. 
The 2007 season was the only season Alabama failed to win at least 10 games in Saban's tenure as head coach. 
2. Alabama junior running back Derrick Henry ran for a career-high 236 yards and two touchdowns against Texas A&M. 
Only LSU's Leonard Fournette has ran for more yards and scored more rushing touchdowns this season than Henry. Henry has 901 rushing yards and 12 rushing touchdowns this season. 
Alabama junior running back Derrick Henry is second in the SEC with 901 rushing yards. He's also second in the SEC with 12 rushing touchdowns. (Photo: Scott Halleran, Getty Images) 
Henry is listed at 6'3" and weighs 242 lbs., according to the Alabama Athletics website. He has run for 125 yards or more in four games this season. 
Henry has scored a touchdown in all seven games Alabama has played this season. Henry is averaging 5.9 yards per carry. 
Alabama is 7-2 in Henry's career when he rushes for 100 yards or more in a game. 
3. Alabama's defense has been stout for most of this season. The Crimson Tide only allow 70.9 rushing yards per game, which is first in the SEC and third in the country. 
The Crimson Tide defense is able to get off of the field forcing 6.86 three-and-outs per game, which is best in the country. 
Alabama's defense has forced a three-and-out on 48-of-109 drives this season (44.0 percent). (Photo: Kevin C. Cox,Getty Images) 
Alabama's defense also allows 271.9 yards per game, which is first in the SEC. 
The Crimson Tide allow 16.7 points per game, which is second in the SEC. 
4. Since losing the turnover battle 5-0 in the loss to Ole Miss , the Crimson Tide have forced 11 turnovers in four games. Alabama has forced 16 turnovers on the season, which is the most in the SEC and seventh nationally. 
Junior defensive back Eddie Jackson leads the Crimson Tide with five interceptions this season. He had two interceptions, returning one of them for a touchdown, against Texas A&M. Jackson leads the SEC in interceptions. 
5. Junior defensive lineman Jonathan Allen leads Alabama with five sacks and seven tackles for a loss on the season. 
6. The Vols are also seeking their first win against an SEC West opponent since beating Ole Miss in 2010. Since then, UT has lost 10 straight against SEC West opponents. 
Alabama has won 19 of its last 20 games at home at Bryant-Denny Stadium. 
Before the Sept. 19 loss to Ole Miss, the Crimson Tide had not lost a game at home since 2012. 
Alabama has the fifth-best home winning percentage in the FBS at Bryant-Denny Stadium with an .817 mark (242-55-3) since the stadium opened in 1929. School
